Summary Heading: AVOID THE LIDO HOUSE- They will sneak rate changes on you that do not match your reservation
Summary: This hotel is actually part of the Bonvoy program which is surprising considering their audacity of defrauding people that do not catch their surprise bait and switch rate increases.  On top of this, their managers hide in the back room leaving their front desk staff powerless.  I have stayed here many times and after what I encountered today will never return.  On top of this I am seeing if Hilton or Hyatt will status match my ambassador status with Bonvoy.  The management is very rude and uses an accusatory tone contradicting what their front desk staff say.  Further they only correspond via the Bonvoy chat function as they cannot be bothered while sitting in the back room.  You can't make up how ridiculous this is.  I'm just happy I caught the $150.00 plus room upcharge that
Room tip: AVOID the Hotel or you will be scammed.  Ants in room on prior stay.
Manager Response: Hi Paul! Thank you for your review.  We have connected with you directly on the matters brought up in your review as we hope to restore your faith in Lido House.  If there is anything else we can do or if you have any further questions, please feel free to reach out as we are happy to discuss.

Summary Heading: Good Stay and Excellent Mayor’s Table Restaurant. Be aware of the Destination Fee.
Summary: Had a free night certificate expiring with Marriott and decided that the best use of it would be redeeming it at  Lido House. While not an oceanfront property, it’s close by and the hotel runs a beach shuttle that’s covered by the destination fee. Reward stays are unfortunately still on the hook for the fee. We parked in the residential neighborhood across the street to save on the valet fee and didn’t have any problems. The nautical theme pervaded the entire property.  We encountered cozy sitting areas on the second floor decorated with multi-story length ropes.   Room and bath were fine.  Connecting room doors were the usual problem and let in guest noise. Still can’t figure out why so many properties embrace them to a such a large extent. They create more problems than they
Room tip: Parking in the adjacent neighborhood is free and safe. Pay attention to street cleaning signs.
Manager Response: Hi Iog! Thank you for your review! We're so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay!  We appreciate the feedback about the connecting rooms and the blackout curtains--we will be sure to relay this information on to the proper people.  Thank you again for choosing Lido House and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. After COVID and a noticeable lack of customer service across all areas (understandable, pay your workers!) it was so refreshing to come to LIDO House and have the level of customer service we experienced. From our check-in with Cory which included beignets and croissants, to a plate of cookies and hats waiting for us in the room (it was my birthday that day), it was all a flawless experience.  Everyone we interacted with from the valets to the trolley driver to the front desk clerks, was so kind, welcoming, and professional.    The hotel itself was spotless and well-maintained, in fact so shiny that we wondered if it was built recently. The outside has gorgeous landscaping, and the inside is designed with nautical artyness that
Manager Response: Hi Colleen! Thank you for your review! We are delighted to hear your great feedback about the hotel and our Coastal Curators! We take great pride in our work and when this is observed and complimented, it is quite inspiring. Thank you for choosing Lido House to celebrate your birthday! We can't wait to welcome you back!

Summary: I had my friend's birthday party at the amazing roof top. The service was amazing, and the view was incredible. Very friendly staff. The rooms were amazing with a cape cod style that really made the experience feel like living at the beach.
Manager Response: Hi Mason! Thank you for your review! We're happy to hear you enjoyed your time at Lido House and Topside.  We can't wait to welcome you back to your "beach house away from home."

Summary Heading: Fantastic meeting experience!  Highly recommend for your lodging and venue space.
Summary: The location and meeting space of the Lido House made our annual meeting for 60 people one of the most favored events.  The proximity to restaurants, the oceanfront, the marina, a grocery store, two coffee shops, and shopping was ideal for attendees to enjoy their time outside of meetings.  The various conversation areas in the lobby's lounge, the Mayor's Table and rooftop bar suited my group well.  The nautical theme created bright, fun rooms.  The Boathouse Ballroom was very open and spacious for hosting successful meetings.  Staff was responsive.  The weather was a tad chilly for our outdoor meals, but the heat lamps, available blankets and addition of indoor table options made it all manageable and fun.  This will be the meeting venue to beat.
Manager Response: Hi Jva! Thank you for your review!  We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your time at Lido House.   Our goal is always to exceed your expectations!   We can't wait to welcome you back.

Summary Heading: Best Newport Beach hotel with nice pool and hot tub and rooftop bar.
Summary: Great location in Newport walkable to beach, lots of restaurants and shops, nice rooftop bar, nice pool and large hottub (cool center courtyard for pool area). If ur lucky enough to get a balcony facing the courtyard, there’s comfy chairs and people watching without any traffic noise. Property was clean and front desk staff was very nice both at check in and check out. A nice Marriott.
Manager Response: Hi Casey! Thank you for your review!  We're glad to hear you enjoyed the amenities on-site, as well as the fun things to do in the area! We hope to welcome you back to Lido House again soon!   P.S., Next time you are planning a stay here please don't hesitate to reach out to us prior to your arrival, so we can do our best to reserve a quality "people-watching" room for you. ;)

Summary: Amazing hotel with a boutique feel. We were stranded over Christmas when our flight was redirected then canceled. The Lido House made us feel welcome right away. Our room was beautiful and the amenities are great. I would just suggest an interior room to avoid the street noise of Newport Blvd. Top notch service from the check-in to the bar/restaurant. The coffee place is awesome too! The hotel is walking distance to the beach! Book this place soon. You’ll be amazed.
Manager Response: Hi Bentley!  Thank you for your review! While being stranded over Christmas does sound a little hectic, we are so happy to hear our Coastal Curators were able to make you feel welcomed and comfortable.  We like to think of ourselves as your "beach house away from home"! :)  Thank you again for helping spread the word about Lido House! We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I had such a great time at this property that we have already booked it again in a few weeks when we are coming out to CA again.  I had just spent a few days at a really difficult business trip in Palm Springs and I couldn’t wait to get to a nice hotel room and relax before I returned to the east coast.  This property was exactly what I needed.  I had a lovely view of the pool and balcony.  The bedding was lovely and there is a great little village nearby with shops, restaurants, etc.  Because we are Marriott Ambassador, we were able to get a late check out.  My only complaint was that the housekeeping did not get that messaging and kept coming in the room to try and clean it…like 4 times.  So, I was not really happy about that, but then my flight was delayed and they made sure
Manager Response: Hi Handhos! Thank you for your review!  We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  Our apologies on behalf of our Housekeeping team for the interruptions on your last day.  We will be sure to relay this information to management to ensure this does not happen again in the future.   Thank you again for the feedback and we look forward to welcoming you back in a couple of weeks!

Summary: My wife and I were celebrating two weekend nights here mid-December for our 27th Anniversary. It was nice receiving an email from Kelsie, a Guest Relations Coordinator reaching out and asking my preferences. Being a Lifetime Titanium Bonvoy Member, I always appreciate when they upgrade my room. I rec'd the room that I requested, an interior pool view room w/outdoor balcony.  We usually stayed at the old St Regis (now Waldorf-Astoria) and Ritz Carlton further south, but the friendly & attentive Lido House employees in all departments, will make this my go-to new Anniversary resort of choice. We had breakfast at the Mayor's House on the main floor w/the Bonvoy complimentary $30 credit each morning. First night we drove south to Mastro's Ocean Club (a must). Second night we stayed
Manager Response: Hi Family of Seven!  Thank you for your loyalty and for taking the time to leave a detailed review.  We're honored you chose Lido House to celebrate your Anniversary and happy to hear you had such a lovely experience!  We agree with you---the wagyu steak and chocolate cake with peanut brittle is worth cancelling off-property reservations for. :)  And we're glad you enjoyed the chocolate covered strawberries and champagne!  We're grateful for guests like you and reviews like this.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I had a terrible experience at this motel. I don't know how Lido House gets away with charging the rates they do when the property is located next to dumpsters and a thrift store and a homeless shelter with views of dirty streets. There is no beach view, so don't be fooled. The views are only of the parking lots. The service is abysmal. The manager Nick shouldn't be working in customer service! The restaurant closes at 9pm so if you're hungry, it's UberEats or starve. The room was dirty with hair on the pillows and an uncleaned toilet and dirty rugs. I was extremely disappointed by this property. Even more disappointing is how LidoHouse doesn't want honest reviews on their site. This is the third time I've written a review for this site, and LidoHouse had my previous reviews
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback.  We are very sorry to hear that you didn't have a great experience in our hotel---our mission is to provide excellent guest experiences, so we are sorry to have let you down.  Our team has been in contact with you to address the issues and we hope to have the opportunity to turn around your impression of Lido House.  Thank you again.

Summary: Nick Lynch is the worst manager w worst customer care. So rude !!!!! I tried to ask for certain accommodations and it was just his attitude and way he spoke to me. I hope the GM understand that this is happening.
Manager Response: Hi Annelise!  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback.  We are very sorry to hear that you didn't have a great experience in our hotel---our mission is to provide excellent guest experiences, so we are sorry to have let you down.  We would like to contact you personally to discuss the matter further.  Please let us know the best way to get in touch with you.  Thank you again.

Summary: ETHAN, DYLAN B, KEVIN B put a smile on my face today by providing excellent service! So nice to have real gentlemen helping me, we had such an amazing time at Lido Hotel this week for Thanksgiving and I'm definitely coming back!My pup now thinks she's 'The Lido Girl' and absolutely did not want her vacation to end.
Manager Response: Hi Tay! Thank you so much for choosing Lido House and for taking the time to leave a review!  We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and that your adorable pup (AKA "The Lido Girl) did as well.  We loved having you as our guests and are looking forward to the next time we see you!

Summary: Our family stayed at the Linda Cottage, one of the 5 "cottages",  or townhouses on the property. 2 bedroom, 2.5 bathrooms. Principal bedroom ensuite bathroom shower stall had quite a bit of mildew, floor was not clean ( not sure if something particular got sticky on the floor), principal bedroom patio door's lock is broken,  dishwasher was still running, cycle not done ( which begs the question if the dishes were completely washed) and rooftop fireplace was not working.  Suffice to say guest relations coordinator , Kelsie Gamez and her manage Ekaterini Avramidis were extremely helpful, courteous  professional and took care of most of the issues. Offered  me a credit and Marriott points on their own volition. However, I feel that the cleaning staff needs to work much harder on
Manager Response: Hi Renae! Thank you for choosing to stay at Lido House and for leaving a review.  I apologize that the room was not up to standard but am happy to hear that Kelsie and Ekaterini were able to take care of you.   I will be sure to relay the information and suggestions to the proper departments so that we can ensure changes are made going forward.  Thank you again for the feedback as it is helpful to know the areas we need to focus on in order to improve the guest experience.  I hope we see you back at Lido House soon!

Summary: Our room faced Newport Blvd., huge mistake. It sounds like the cars, motorcycles are driving through our room. There are also so many exterior lights that even though we have all the shades down it is still light in our room at 1 am. The noise from the restaurant in the hotel also comes into the room since our door opens into the atrium. Not sure if we are also getting noise from the rooftop bar as well. All in all not the hotel to stay in if you want to sleep at night. Hard to believe this is a room they give to a Marriott Titanium Elite member. I am not sure I can spend a second night here.
Manager Response: Good Morning Mr. Manson,  It was a pleasure to speak with you earlier regarding your concerns with the noise around your room and I thank you for your time. We are truly sorry for falling short of your expectations and not being able to provide a calm and relaxing environment in which we are known for. I hope that we are able to serve you again in the near future and I would be happy to look after you on your return visit to ensure that you are well taken care of. Have a great weekend and we hope to see you soon.

Summary: You know a hotel is run well when the quality of service and professionalism of its staff is run so well.  JC from the bellhop service was outstanding.  We were exhausted from extended travel drama, and he picked that up immediately.  He made our check-in process and settling into the room incredibly easy and quick.
Manager Response: Hi GJ! Thanks so much for choosing Lido House and for taking time to leave a review!  I will be sure to relay the message on to the rest of the team!  It's our pleasure to provide the best possible service to our guests, and we're glad that this commitment was reflected in your visit.  We look forward to the next time we're able to serve you again!

Summary: Amazing service from Noah Barlow!!  He brought up our luggage so quickly and we are ready for our weekend to celebrate our friends 30th bday at lido! Thank you for your wonderful service to our room. He offered ice, shared where the AC was located, and made us feel welcome.
Manager Response: Hi Jamie! Thanks so much for staying at Lido House and for leaving a review! We're glad to hear Noah was able to provide such wonderful service; we will be sure to pass your compliments on to him.  Our hotel prides itself in providing exemplary service and it is wonderful when that is felt and acknowledged by one of our guests.  Thank you again for taking time to share your experience and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We recently visited Lido House for a friends wedding and it was such an awesome experience! As local OC residents we didn’t know such place existed in the heart of Newport. The venue was so pretty and the food was cooked perfectly. The hotel has like an ocean feel to it and it’s clean and very modern. We visited the bridal suite and that was very nice! It was spacious and even had an elevator inside. The bar house modern area for the reception was beautiful. Simple and elegant at the same time! We valeted so not sure on the public parking but considering the location the valet was very fairly priced. Over the course of the weekend, I used the valet 4 times and it quick easy time. Noah grabbed our car after the wedding and even though we had our toddler with us, he waited
Manager Response: Hi Rosaliam!  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review!  We're so happy to hear you enjoyed the time you spent at Lido House.  We like to refer to ourselves as your "local beach house," so next time you're in need of a staycation by the ocean, we hope you'll keep us in mind! :)

Summary Heading: Great Staycation Location in Newport Beach
Summary: Although we live in Southern California and can be in Newport Beach in less than an hour, the thought of a Staycation in Newport Beach has long intrigued us. We selected the Lido House because of its walking proximity to the beach and to local restaurants.  The Pacific Ocean is just a short walk down 32nd Street from the hotel. We walked out to the beach and enjoyed the walk in the sand and watched the waves bringing the surfers in for a ride.  On returning to the hotel, we went up to the Topside Roof Deck for drinks and appetizers while enjoying the breeze as the sun headed for the ocean.  Later we walked a short distance over to an excellent local restaurant for dinner before returning to our coastal themed room.   The Crew Coffee +  Cremerie on the hotel grounds serves up a
Manager Response: Hi there! Thanks so much for your detailed review. Sounds like you made the most out of your staycation and really got a chance to see and do quite a bit!  We're happy you chose Lido House for your time in Newport Beach and hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Nice interior design but overall a total disappointment given the price point at this property.  The in room amenities were just slightly better than what you would expect at a budget hotel - for example, there was a bath robe, a coffee machine, and Davines Momo bath products but other than that, there was a cheap blow dryer and the room lacked a mini bar.  The pool water was cloudy and looked dirty and hotel staff rarely came by to pickup up empty glasses and refresh vacated chairs.  The hotel also needs to invest in soundproofing - so much noise from the street, valet, and parking lot - was very hard to get a good night sleep.  All in all if you want to enjoy a nice hotel near the water in Southern California this is NOT the place to stay - there are much better options in San
Manager Response: Good Morning, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. It is disappointing to see that your experience fell short of the high standards our guests have come to expect and enjoy at our property.  Thank you again for your review, we have reached out to you directly and would like the opportunity to speak with you directly to restore your confidence in our hotel.

Summary Heading: Massively overpriced for the quality of room service and amenities.
Summary: Price of a 5 star resort at $750/night plus over $100 in fees but lacking all around. Room was ok but walls thin and very noisy at night. No minibar, 2 mini bottles of water only. No breakfast or included food options. Mediocre all around for such a high price.
Manager Response: Hi Katherep!  Thank you for your valuable feedback of your recent stay with us.    We strive to always provide a comfortable and enjoyable ambiance for all of our guests, and it appears we fell short of these expectations during your visit.  While I am sorry to hear about your experience, your feedback is important to us to help us improve in the mentioned areas and allow us to further elevate our services.  We hope you may give us the opportunity to welcome you again in the future when your travel plans bring you back to Newport Beach.

Summary: Overall we enjoyed our stay at this small charming hotel, but we did have a few bumps and a few comments to make.      We liked the style of our room that continued the yacht club vibe of the hotel.  The blue and white room was cheerful with some built-in shelving, textured walls, and custom light fixtures that gave the space a homey but sophisticated look. We also appreciated ample drawer space and an empty mini refrigerator to put our own items in. We did not use the TV during our stay, but if we had, the best way would have been from the bed as the lounger in the room faces away from the screen.  The black and white tiled bathroom was attractive with a large walk-in shower. We did have an issue with the air conditioning not really getting to a comfortable level until the
Manager Response: Hi J and A! Thank you for taking the time to leave such a detailed review.  We appreciate this kind of feedback as we are able to relay the information to the correct people and ensure we continue to improve the guest experience.  Thank you again for the helpful information and we hope to have the chance to host you again in the future.

Summary: +ve Great location with easy access to Lido Marina Village Nice design and decor Pool area was very comfortable and our kids loved the pool Valet team were always friendly   -ve I’m not sure the hotel has quite worked out who it’s catering for - corporate events, young families or weekend party-goers. Each has very different (and sometimes conflicting) needs which the hotel probably doesn’t fully address. At the weekend day pass users fill up the loungers by the pool (and the corner loungers and cabanas are all “reserved”) so hotel guests are not guaranteed a space. If you charge a “resort fee” to guests staying at the hotel this is frankly unacceptable Our bed was really uncomfortable and gave us  back pain almost immediately Service at the front desk lacked the warmth and
Manager Response: Hi Laurence! Thank you for taking the time to leave a review.  We appreciate the feedback and welcome the chance to hear from our guests and the experiences they have at our hotel.  Our goal is to always improve and the best way to do that is to hear directly from the people whose opinions matter the most--our guests!  We're glad you enjoyed the location, design, decor, and pool area!  I do want to clarify, our pool and jacuzzi are for hotel guests ONLY.  We do not offer day passes for sale.  We place "reserved" signs in front of the loungers and cabanas as hotel guests must still reserve these ahead of time.  We are a smaller property with limited space, so the daybeds and cabanas fill up quickly.  We apologize for the confusion or for any misinformation.   Thank you again for your review and we hope to have a chance to host you at our property again!

Summary Heading: Great stay, more “coastal curation “ would be helpful
Summary: This is a super cool and comfortable resort. Many perks are available, but we had to ask to find out. Free shuttle to the beach, including chairs, towels and umbrella. Free bicycles with helmets and locks.  One staff member told us that the original concept was that all staff were supposed to be “coastal curators “, curating good times for all guests. A brief orientation would be helpful.  A guest should not have to ask what is available.
Manager Response: Hi jocdocThornhill!   Thank you for staying at Lido House and taking time to leave a review.  Not only are we Coastal Curators here to curate good times and experiences for all guests, but we are also an Autograph Collection property thoughtfully designed to be "exactly like nothing else."  I'm sorry to hear it sounds like we fell short of these marks this time.  Please feel free to call me at the hotel directly if there is anything else you'd like to share about your experience.  We would love the opportunity to WOW you.  We hope to have a chance to host you in the future so that you are able to experience Lido House as it was intended. Wishing you all the best!

Summary: We had walked by the Lido House one day while spending time in Newport Beach and decided to spend our anniversary there even though we live only 50 miles away.  We invited another couple to join us.  The hotel is well located in walking distance to shops and restaurants as well as to boating activities.  The decor is lovely and the room was very comfortable.  In spite of staffing shortages in the food industry we found the service at the Mayor's Table to be excellent.  Our waitress, Kalei, was excellent.  It is definitely a happy place with a friendly crew and a place we look forward to returning to.
Manager Response: Hi FLB!  Thank you for your review!  We're honored you chose Lido House to celebrate such a special occasion and we're so happy to hear you enjoyed your time.  We will be sure to pass your kind words on to Kalei as well.  We do consider ourselves a friendly crew always looking to provide our guests with excellent customer service---and we're happy to hear it sounds like we hit the mark this time!  Thank you again for choosing Lido House and we can't wait to welcome you back!

Summary Heading: Slice of Paradise in Newport Beach
Summary: We absolutely LOVED our stay at the Lido House. From the moment we arrived, the staff went over and above to make our stay special and like one we would never forget. It was Mother's Day and we were greeted with a mimosa bar in the lobby - what a special treat! Our room wasn't ready yet (understandable) so they safely stored our items and we were able to enjoy the beautiful pool while we waited - they even took the milk for my 1 year old and safely stored it in the fridge. We ate almost all of our meals at The Mayor's Table, and if you can request that your server is Rick. He was INCREDIBLE. So knowledgeable and friendly. Our 3 year old said "I miss Mr. Rick" the other day when we were at a restaurant back home. If you are in Southern California, you MUST stay at Lido House.
Manager Response: Hi Clodagh!  Wow! We thoroughly enjoyed reading your review--thank you for taking the time to share your experience! We're so happy our staff was able to assist in making your time with us memorable and also that you enjoyed the amenities we were offering.  Reading reviews like this from guests like you means the world to us--thank you again.  We hope you'll come back again soon.

Summary: Lido House is a lovely property perfectly situated in Newport Beach. The beach, marina, restaurants and shopping all easily walkable. Some hotels live off their location and fall down a bit in service. Lido House is the opposite. The guest services is fantastic: attentive, friendly and ever present. A totally enjoyable weekend. I wish the Topside deck had longer hours but that’s not a big deal.
Manager Response: Hi Sharon! Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review! We're so happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us.  We do strive to ensure our customers feel completely taken care of whenever they're staying with us, and we're happy to hear we met the mark this time!  Come back and see us again soon.

Summary Heading: A perfect weekend at the Lido House!
Summary: Great stay and even better service! The hotel was busy but they handled the crowd wonderfully. The staff were all very pleasant and seemed to be really enjoying their jobs. The hotel has a great vibe and the pool area bars and restaurants were amazing. We stayed in a suite which was huge! Room was decorated amazingly and comfortable and cozy. Beds were comfortable and the place was spotless. We left behind our iPad and they called us a few days later and sent it to our home fed ex. Now that’s service. Can’t wait for our next stay. We love the Lido house!
Manager Response: Damandel, we are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay at Lido House, Autograph Collection! Thank you for the kind words on our service, our restaurants, and rooms - it was our pleasure to serve as your beach house for the weekend. We can't wait to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: This is a really nice updated hotel. Staff is super responsive, pool is perfect, restaurant is onsite with an excellent bar. Location is close to great places to eat and the beach is close by too. An it even smells nice. Gym is perfect....not too big. Open 24 hours. Stay here. Maybe a bit $$$ for some but thats Newport for you. PS. Starbuck is right across the parking lot.
Manager Response: Dear Jeffrey D,  Thank you for staying at the Lido House, Autograph Collection and for writing about your enjoyable experience. The needs of our guests are indeed our top priority. We are glad this is apparent in the quality of service you received, from your restaurant experience to our guest amenities. It was a pleasure hosting you, and we hope to do so again the next time you are in our area.  Best, Sarah Stanley Executive Assistant

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with a helpful staff
Summary: I recently stayed at the Lido house during a business trip. The hotel is beautiful. The staff is top notch. I realized on my way to the airport after checking out that I forgot my bracelet in the  room. I called the hotel. They quickly retrieved it and overnighted it back to me. They went above and beyond! I’ll be back for sure. This is my favorite spot in Newport Beach to stay.
Manager Response: Dear friedarakh,  We are happy to know you enjoyed your time with us and our refined twist on the Coastal style. Thank you for the kind comments about our beautiful property, our excellent location, and our dedicated associates. We look forward to welcoming you back to Lido House, Autograph Collection, the New-Old Centerpiece of Newport Beach.  Best, Sarah Stanley Executive Assistant

Summary: Our first stay at Lido House - likely won't return.  It was fine, but not really worth the points and / or $$.  Rooms are small, really not a whole lot of perks for Titanium Elite for life members (had to beg for a 1 pm check out on a Sunday for the room we had facing the parking lot)..  We requested robes, but were told not available because of COVID... interesting and first time we heard that one... and we've stayed in a lot of hotels during COVID.  Pool attendant was nice and very helpful.  Rooftop deck / bar - cool vibe.  The Mayors Table limited breakfast food options and service - waiter was sidetracked ….coffee came the same time as food and then coffee didn't get refilled - even though it was acknowledged (finally came though).  There is daily fee of $50 for a resort
Manager Response: Dear travelingcrew,  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent visit to the area. It was disappointing to read your experience did not live up to our typical standards. Please accept our apologies for providing anything less than the exceptional service for which we are known. We hope you will consider giving us another chance to prove we are up to the task of delivering excellent service and accommodations.  Best, Sarah Stanley Executive Assistant

Summary: The room was very clean and spacious, the stay included a pool and a roof top bar. The staff was very friendly and Joe was very helpful. The location of the Lido house was perfect for a weekend getaway.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After staying at mostly JW Marriott's for our Wedding Anniversary we decided to give the Lido House in Newport Beach a try.  This property is beautiful.  The staff were awesome.  From the Valet/Bellman and Front Desk Staff to Housekeeping.   The room was comfortable and inviting.   Pool and Hot Tub area was spotless and warm.  The only complaint it is hard to find the Hot Tub controls at night as bushes have overgrown on them.   Location was perfect for our needs.   Restaurants and beach very nearby.   We enjoyed our stay immensely and will be returning in the near future.   Thank you Lido House staff for making our stay memorable!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm currently at this property and would say the resort is in a great location and the hotel is relatively new. However the service at times can be non-existent, which I index to being the most important part of my stay. The pool service was great yesterday but this morning I have called down to the front desk many times and no one answers. My pain point is that I wanted to relax in bed this morning and order room service. The food has not come in two hours and every time (3 calls) they would say we have your order and I see a runner is bringing it up now. As the front desk would not answer I had no way to push this process forward. I had to go to the restaurant directly to put in a new order to get my food.   I was looking between Pelican Hill and this property and I now regret
Manager Response: Dear Ryan B.,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our Beach House and providing us with your feedback. Delivering the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and I sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations.  Fulfilling a timely room service order or being reachable via telephone are foundations of our service elements and I am sorry to hear that we missed the mark in both areas.   I have reached out to you directly to ensure a timely follow-up and resolution to the mentioned points.   Please do not hesitate to connect with me at your earliest convenience and I hope we will be able to welcome you back in the future when the next occasion arises.  Sincerely, André Brose General Manager

Summary: About 3 years old in 2021, so everything is nice and new.   All of the service people we worked with were friendly and helpful. We interacted with at least 10 durning our 5 day stay. I would say the service was what I would expect from this sort of resort.   Very close to fire station, they go out often during the day and early evening but we did not hear much at night. With the windows open there a bit of traffic noise until about 11 PM. You can be close to a very busy street (Newport Blvd) and some people like loud exhaust systems.   Beds and pillows were fine for sleeping for me.   We had a balcony room and the balcony was large. Like one 6 place table and another area larger than that. However there were not any umbrellas and so hard to use the table until the sun goes down
Manager Response: Dear  WilliamC791,  Thank you for joining us and for providing us with your feedback. We are happy to know that you enjoyed your overall stay. Still, please accept our apologies for not delivering the exceptional visit you anticipated concerning our outlets and our location. We are devoted to giving each guest a memorable stay and are disappointed to know this was not your experience. It would be our pleasure to welcome you back to our hotel so you can receive the service excellence for which we are known.  Sincerely, Sarah Stanley Executive Assistant

Summary: We loved our time here. Meticulously clean and friendly staff. We utilized the little shuttle to the beach and used bikes one evening. One of the very few times I’ve found the shower handle was located on the opposite wall as the shower head, so you don’t get that blast of cold water on your arm when you turn on the shower. A small, but thoughtful thing. Breakfast was a real eye opener as to the quality of the kitchen. It’s clear the kitchen is staffed with chefs, not cooks. Next time we’ll stay in the hotel for dinner.

The rooms are very comfortable, a great gyn (with Peleton bikes) and really nice pool/hot tub set up in a courtyard.      Food in the hotel is fantastic, and the rooftop bar is a lot of fun.    Great perks for elite Bonvoy members.

Summary: After recently visiting the Lido House, I am totally puzzled by the reviews that call this a beach hotel in an excellent location. I found the setting to be dismal. I also don't understand why Lido House is categorized as an Autograph Collection. The hotel is flanked by parking lots and unattractive, utilitarian businesses.  The ocean is a 10-minute walk (if you're moving fast), past a strip mall and across two major boulevards. The hotel has very much a Courtyard Marriott footprint: in a small U shape, with a little pool in the center bordered by fake grass, a small lobby and virtually no landscaping. Manager Response: Dear Jamie C,  Thank you for being a dedicated Marriott Elite Bonvoy member; we appreciate you choosing our hotel for your recent vacation and posting a review of your thoughts about your stay. The hotel itself was so clean and comfortable. The rooms were so well thought out and we absolutely loved the design of our room. There was enough space for all of our bags and stuff and we didn't even want to leave the room because it was so dang comfortable. The staff was amazing and extremely friendly. We did have breakfast at the restaurant and it was delicious. I would absolutely come back here for a romantic weekend getaway. Awesome property!

Summary: A rare find! Beautiful small hotel so Newport Beach but could be any coastal eastern town. Light and breezy. From the moment you pull up to the front door it feels good. They have a beautiful old “woody” station wagon that takes you to town and also a shuttle. The lobby is airy and welcoming. The staff from valets to bellman to front desk and housekeeping are genuinely welcoming. I had a double queen room overlooking the pool and cabanas. Slight ocean view wasn’t even a necessity. Atmosphere was very clean and beachy. Wonderful big shower . Refrigerator, keurig coffee and tea. Large tv.Very comfortable! Lovely sleep machine by the bed. Everything well thought out and placed. Great food at “The Mayors Table.” Will definitely stay here again. Even had beach bikes.

The pool area is great with cute cabanas and great drinks/food. For the beach - cute little "trolley" and they will set up chairs. Or, less than a 10 minute walk to take a morning walk.  It is also very close to Lido Shopping Area with really great shops.   We'll be back! It quickly became our #1 choice for a quick weekend away on the west coast.

Summary: I give this property kudos for the tremendous attention to detail in the guest room appointments.  Four different kinds of tile in the bathroom in addition to carrara marble accents, 5 different throw pillow fabrics, each piece of furniture was unique, leather pulls on one of the cabinets, 3 kinds of flooring (hardwood in the entrance, carpet in the bedroom and tile on the balcony), lovely stemmed wine glasses with brass wine bucket and tray, metallic-toned waste basket in the bathroom, books, objet d'art and bibelot on the shelves.  Adirondack chairs and battery-powered hurricane candle on the balcony.  A built-in white noise machine sealed the deal.  This is a quintessential boutique hotel and may not be for everyone.  It's not on the beach or the harbor, with zero views.

Summary: What a crazy experience. We visited the rooftop bar tonight and paid what I would consider to be over a premium price. Caviar fries $33 without caviar for fries $22. Olives $13 etc. we bought wine and spent over $1500 for 9 people which is fine if you are up for that kind of night. What was amazing and so frustrating was that we never received one server or bidder in 3.5 hours sitting there. We actually ended up carrying our used plates back to the bar after they had piled up on our table for 2 hours. Disgusting service, worst I have experienced in America. What I would say is the wagyu is amazing for the price and was the highlight. The security guy was also amazing. Rest of the team need a lot of training and growth.

Summary: Lido House is just off US 1. You don't expect to find a Cape Cod–style beach hotel with 130 rooms and a prime position on the Balboa and Lido Peninsulas. The location embodies California summer. The hotel sits on the former City Hall site and has a saltwater pool, with cabanas, spa and CrossFit-inspired fitness center, and a slew of restaurant choices including a seafood focussed gastropub, a rooftop bar, and an quaint ice cream and coffee shop. For big families, they have three-story residential-style cottages, all beautifully and tastefully designed. The aesthetic of each is completely different—from midcentury to Nantucket cool - and they all have rooftop decks with fire pits and gas BBQ grills. Great spot!

Check-in was welcoming and easy, and we were pleased to find out we’d been upgraded. Our new room was clean, large, comfortable, beautifully decorated, and came with a fully equipped small kitchen (do people actually cook full meals in these rooms?) and best of all a Nespresso machine. The stylish, sizable bathroom had Davines amenities and a large walk-in shower. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. Our 4th floor room overlooked the pool and gave us a glimpse of ocean in the distance. However, it was on the same floor as the Topside Bar which packs in drunk and screaming 20-somethings for wild nights of drinking and screaming.

They have a very unique shuttle to the beach where they give you free chairs towels etc.  Every single person there was very friendly and attentive to whatever you needs were. Rooms were very nice beds very comfortable (standard room). Food items were very good we had breakfast lunch and dinner there. Some unique items on both the food and drink menu. You can walk to the beach in 5 min or less.  Overall we just had an amazing stay. I will be back soon. Keep up the good work Lido House.

Summary: Stayed 3 nights. Great ambience, beautiful rooms, excellent restaurant & event food in my experience. 5+ minutes to beach, 20 to pier, walking distance to much of Newport Beach and there are bikes to rent for longer jaunts (Lido Isle, Balboa Peninsula and Island, even Corona Del Mar, all worth exploring).   Although you can see masts bobbing in the distance, its immediate surroundings aren't quite so glamorous - gas station, a small mall, parking lots etc. It makes up for this a bit with really nice outdoor areas and landscaping (including the pool), most of which are focused inwards for the above reason. Obviously, land for construction on the water itself would have been impossibly expensive for Marriott.   If you must be indoors, the gym is small but well equipped. However,

Summary: Great location convenient to everything.  We walked to dinner each night and had great sushi and coffee very near by.  The bikes the hotel provides were fun and we were able to ride to Balboa island for a great breakfast and then walk them on the ferry for the trip back. Only downside was that after sitting in traffic from L. A. on a Friday, we just wanted to sit by the pool and have a drink, (there was no bar) or head to the roof top and watch the sunset and chill. But the  rooftop is a crazy wild local scene that requires a wrist bracelet to get into.  Lots of fun if you are in your 20's but after having our ID's checked (we are well over 21) and getting a purple paper wrist band we turned around.  There just isn't anywhere at the hotel for a wind down drink where it is quiet

Family above us with kids ran and ran and stomped until after 1am both nights. Couldn’t believe a parent would even allow this! No menu in the room so we didn’t know they had room service. No one told us of the resort charge or what it entailed. We sorely underused the facilities for this reason. We had no idea there was a shuttle to the beach or paddle boards or even bikes! The gal at check in seemed really young and didn’t have answers to questions. Pool was crowded and there were a lot of kids so if you don’t like that sort of thing, don’t go here. Rooftop bar had a local crowd that looks like they’re fresh off the jersey

For that reason, your concerns about parking fees, your accommodations, resort fees, and front desk service have been shared with our management team to address with our staff. Thank you again for choosing us and we wish you continued safe travels.   Sincerely, Adam Beer General Manager

Now that both loyalty programs are combined I choose to book some complimentary nights at this very new property for those hard earned points for my family trip through the West of the US. As we arrived at Lido House to check in for a two-night stay the very friendly lady asked me if, despite we booked two rooms with 2 queen beds each, we would be happy to take an upgrade to a Harbor Cottage instead due to my Gold Elite status....These have two bedrooms and with an extra inflatable mattress we could fit the five of us comfortably in. Summary Heading: Home from home - one of my favourite hotels!
Summary: The service at this hotel is second to none. The staff really do go out of their way to make each and every stay as enjoyable as possible.  Recently renovated the hotel is extremely well appointment. Even a standard king room is spacious and bathrooms are excellent.  The restaurant is great, with high quality food at a reasonable price.  The bar is excellent, staff always super friendly and again great service. There’s even shuffle board!   There’s a great outdoor pool too, with plenty of sun loungers and cabanas.   Great location - just a short walk from the beach.   Always thanked for loyalty and usually get a room upgrade for titanium status.   Wouldn’t stay anywhere else in the Newport Beach/ Irvine Area when in town for business or pleasure

Summary Heading: Fantastic boutique hotel in an amazing location!
Summary: I watched as they built this property over the past few years. My travel plans finally took me back so I could experience it for myself, I had heard great things from colleagues who had already visited. This hotel is truly exceptional! The layout and decor are so unique, truly a boutique experience throughout. I usually don't enjoy hotel-based restaurants much but the Mayor's Table won me over. We ended up eating most of our meals there, the food and service was great. The cozy, casual atmosphere at this location made me (almost) forget that I was at a hotel and felt more like home. I am definitely coming back with my kids to enjoy the pool and the local area even more!
Manager Response: Dear AlwaysOnTheGo559,  Thank you for choosing the Lido House, Autograph Collection and for your generous review. Thank you again for taking the time to share about your stay, and we cannot wait to welcome you and your family soon.  Sincerely, Adam Beer General Manager

Summary Heading: Light and Open in a Great Location
Summary: Our family of four including high school aged daughter and college student on break son stayed for a few days in mid June. I was not sold on staying there, but my wife won out and I'm glad she did. The rooms and grounds have an ocean theme and are light and airy. Baths are well appointed with roomy showers. The location is great and within walking area of the beach and several off property restaurants. We had a breakfast, a dinner, and Father's day Brunch at the Mayors table and each meal was great. Must trys include: the mimosa cart, truffle fries (Oh ya...), and  Shakshouka. Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Dear stanb716,  Thank you for choosing the Lido House, Autograph Collection and for your generous review. We are thrilled to know you also enjoyed our beautiful location and the delicious food offerings at our on-site restaurant. Thank you again for your kind words and recommendations. We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Sincerely, Adam Beer General Manager

Summary: We loved our stay at the Lido House! Our family of 5 stayed in the beautifully decorated Bay Cottage which was more than a home away from home and especially loved the rooftop decks. The friendly and helpful staff at Lido house were such a pleasure. Anything we needed was at our fingertips: bikes, beach chairs a shuttle to the beach or cocktails by the pool. We cannot wait to return!

Summary: Great family stay at the beautiful Lido House property. Excellent location within walking distance to beach, Lido shops and restaurants. Two queen beds in the room were ample for our family of four. We appreciated the showers with high end fixtures. Front desk check in could have been better though. The young ladies were aloof and didn’t explain the property amenities or our  Marriott benefits at all. We had to figure it out in our own. The valet guys, on the other hand, were outstanding and so friendly always offering to help with directions and recommendations. Thanks guys! Yes the pool is small but adequate even during a busy holiday week.

Summary: We stayed at the Lido house the first week in July. The property was very stylish and beautifully appointed.  Great location. Walking distance to the beach, great restaurants and charming shops.  In my view, the best attribute of this hotel was the outstanding service. Every person working there seemed to genuinely appreciate their customers. As an example, we ate at the Mayor's Table restaurant for breakfast daily. We had the same waiter, Kareem. He was absolutely outstanding remembering our names and our order preferences. He was delightful and made our stay at the Lido House that much nicer.  Highly recommend this hotel!

We had an issue with the shower fixture (it would not turn off) and the one positive element of our stay was that maintenance came quickly.  The front desk staff was indifferent. The GM reached out a week earlier to ask the occasion for my trip, and I told her that I was celebrating the start of a new job. How surprised was I to return to my room the first night to find a bottle of wine and goodies waiting for me. You can't know how much those little gestures make us, oftentimes weary, travelers feel appreciated.  The Lido team went above and beyond to make a loyal customer feel valued throughout my stay, from the front desk to the restaurant

No complaints.  Really cute hotel!

Hats off to the Lido House, see you again soon!

I had a harbor view 2 queen bedroom. The white cape cod feel of the room had a beach home type feel that I love. Everything was so nicely decorated from the shelves with octopus statue to the shiplap on the wall. The balcony was a great touch with the cute chairs and the table, it was a great place to drink a nice glass of wine and relax.   I just went a few weeks ago to celebrate my 30th birthday and me and my best friends stayed in the Bay Cottage. We were BLOWN AWAY by this 3 story cottage! it was like our own beach home. Kudos to Andrew Bryant on the Room Operations team, he upgraded our room and had a great amenity and hand written note on our arrival. We enjoyed the roof top bar, twice. All the staff across the property were smiling and made us feel welcome. Looking forward to going back. Thank you!

Summary: I love a good location, and this hotel meets this measure with 5 stars, but the hotel lacks some key features I expect from a hotel of this level.  Assuming all else is great, from the free bike rentals to get to local shops and dinning, and the views and weather being good.  No room service, they have box breakfast but do not offer full service of dinning.  Rooms lack thoughtful functional design from both a size of room, but also bathroom layout and privacy.  A poor positioned wood bench at the end of the bed made navigating to the bathroom a near death trap at 3 am...  Amenities, like rooftop bar are seasonal and not predictable.

We appreciate you sharing you enjoyed your time with us, and our ideally placed location here in the heart of Newport Beach, steps away from Lido Marina Village. It was our pleasure hosting you, and we hope you will come back to see us soon.  Sincerely, Adam Beer General Manager

Checked in an 11am and didn't want to wait for an Ambassador upgrade to a balcony room so was okay with a standard room, which I was able to get into immediately.  The girl at the desk was SO helpful and friendly! Loved her positive attitude! The lobby in the hotel smells AMAZING!    I was put on the 3rd floor and my room was lovely! So nautical, so cute, and SPOTLESS! The rain shower was awesome, and the bath products that were provided smelled great.  I loved the flip flops instead of slippers, and 2 complimentary bottles of Fiji water was nice. 2 robes in the room, which were soft and cozy.  Comfy bed, and they also have a "white noise" machine, which helped me

I spent a lot of time in my room because I had business meetings and the Executive Suite was perfect!

A nice touch are the Cruiser bikes that are provided with the stay so you never have to drive.  We biked to the Wedge, up and down the boardwalk and to Balboa Island area where we rented a Duffy Boat for a self guided 2 hour tour of the inner harbor at Newport.  The weekend was a blast.

More robust WiFi in the fitness center, and a better selection of treats in the gift shop. Gummi bears and dark chocolate expresso beans were inadequate temptations for our sweet toothes.

Summary: This hotel is gorgeous but the fees they charge are way out of line.  The room was $303 and then they added $40 for valet parking, $30 for destination fee (have no idea what that is), and then taxes of $45 for a grand total of $416.  So the extra fees were 33% added to the original price of the room.  I find that a little extreme.  As for the hotel, it was really pretty and I would stay there again.  The location is great as well.  The on site restaurant menu looked okay but nothing I wanted to spend $30-40 a person with a mostly fish menu.  They had a cool rooftop bar as well but food was also fish, so we skipped that as well.  So, I would try it if you can get a good price on the room.

So pleasant and sweet. Great bar, pool, spacious and comfortable rooms. Rooftop bar is a blast. Also come for a guys weekend or just the girls. So much fun to be around this cute town. You just can’t go wrong and it’s a MARRIOTT

The staff is outstanding. the rooms are impeccable, it all feels like home. Hands down, 5 stars!

Summary: It’s fresh. Beautifully-appointed, nautical-themed hotel right by the busy Newport Blvd. not on the water. 15 mins from OC airport.   Upon arrival I went straight to the bar and paid $42 for two bloody Mary’s.   The room decor is really nice but the closet is tiny. The TV reception was not good. And two of the 3 HBO channels were blank.   The rooftop bar is a great spot for people watching. Bring your Botox.   We didn’t try the restaurant. I did order a $12 yogurt parfait that was delicious.   We did take advantage of the complimentary bikes and ride on the beach (5 blocks away). It’s hard to beat the SoCAL breeze. The Newport Pier is about a 10 minute ride — A great vantage point for watching the surfers.   Overall the hotel has a good vibe. I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Love this place and so did our guests, but.......
Summary: We have loved this hotel since it opened.  Being local we have not spent the night but have eaten and had cocktails there.  Recently we treated some friends to an overnight there.  They, too, loved the place and their accommodations.  However, I just looked at the bill.  Besides the normal valet parking  and what is usually referred to as city and state tax (here called Fees), there is a Destination fee (often called Resort fee), an Occupancy tax, a Destination Occupancy tax, and a Destination Newport Beach Fee.  We've stayed in a great many hotels in a great many cities and countries and I've never seen such a long list of fees and taxes.  Why not just call out the room rate as a bit higher rather than add 20% in fees and taxes.

Summary Heading: Below Average Experience for Overpriced Hotel
Summary: This was a staycation for us and the experience was below average. It's a very nice looking hotel but that's where the positives end. Service is terrible especially at the pool, the staff can't answer basic questions and simple amenities like room service or coffee in the room are limited and not 24hrs. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Summary Heading: Location is fantastic, potential is incredible, service is lacking
Summary: So everything you've read here is true...Lido House has so much potential, but the service is almost unbearable. One hour for a hamburger at the pool. No bar service on the front patio. 2 bartenders on the rooftop bar - not nearly enough. 1 hour 15 minutes for scrambled eggs at breakfast. At 4:45 pm our room had not been cleaned. Menus are limited. The list goes on... In general, the staff were nice and tried their best to be helpful, but Lido House just doesn't have the infrastructure to support their guests. I really hope this hotel can figure it out, because it's the only game in town with a fantastic location on the peninsula with walking access to restaurants, bars and the beach.  PS - please add a light beer to your menus! PSS - We received a follow up email from Lido

Summary: So first of all, I understand the place is new, so perhaps they can learn from this review. We live up on the bluff in Newport and have been excited for this place to open, so this past weekend my wife and two daughters went to take a look at the property, partly because I am looking for a place to celebrate my 40th at the end of June. My wife ran across the street to get a manicure, so my daughter and I waited in their lounge area playing the shuffle board game which was fun. I had a beer and she had a shirley temple, we ordered some fries to hold us over until my wife came. She arrived and we wanted to order some food while we ralxed and played shuffle board. Summary Heading: Hip Boutique -esq hotel that is actually a Marriott
Summary: The hotel is beautifully done.  The rooms are comfortable (a little on the small side) and look very fashionable.  It is a very popular hotel for drinks and evening.  So much so that I had to stop and show my room key while walking up with my 10 year old and hands full.  A bit ridiculous but at least they are checking.  The location is great.  Near the beach in a super cute part of town.  You can walk anywhere or take one of the free bikes they allow you to check out and ride around the peninsula.  Our family enjoyed that very much.  I can't comment on the food because we didn't eat there but it is a stones throw away from great eats in the hood.  Which I recommend you explore. Summary: The service was outstanding at this brand new hotel. Super clean, and state of the art. The pool and jacuzzi are lovely. There are a few games tucked in the back area of the pool! Check them out including skeeball. Walk to the beach is easy. Try picking up stuff you forgot at the supermarket across street from hotel. The guys at the valet are all nice, and great on giving tips on where to eat and visit locally. We’d return in the future when back in the Newport Beach area!

Summary: This hotel is amazing! The decor is so beautiful! I stayed here with my kids in a little suite with a kitchen. The room was the perfect size. My boys loved the pool and the hot tub! I worked out at the gym and it was hands down the best hotel gym I’ve been to. We walked to the beach for the sunset and it was so close ! I will definitely try to make it back someday !
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Snobby, Overpriced, Unfriendly, Jaw-Dropping Ludicrous Dress Code at the Beach
Summary: I am a lifelong resident of this area and this place does not reflect anything about the Newport Peninsula.  It's a quasi-Beverly Hills, overly fancy place right at the beach and has the audacious policy to not allow anyone to their rooftop without closed toed shoes, NO hats and only collared shirts.  On top of that ridiculousness, it's CLOSED during the day time!  Why anyone would close a rooftop at the beach when it's clear blue skies is beyond all reason and to force people to dress up and get turned away in my Gucci $800 flip flops is the icing on the cake.  Do not go here.  They will learn when the non-suspecting tourists go away and none of the locals, who could be their bread and butter darken their doors. Summary Heading: Promising Hotel -Stil working out Service Issues
Summary: Stayed for a week and had a nice time. The building is very well done and is in a great location. It does feel like a really new hotel that they are still trying to figure out to to run smoothly. Spotty service levels in the restaurant but the food was outstanding. Loved the bikes that were available to take and ride around Newport Beach. The local shuttle that is advertised in mostly non existent. They do have an Escalade  for that service but there was never enough valets on staff to drive it. Roof top bar opened while we were there and its a really nice spot. Staff is mostly trying hard to figure it out. I have really high hopes for this hotel. Will be back to try it again.

Summary: Really appreciate interesting hotel as it is a cool inspiring departure from your typical Marriott property. However, major flaw is the way they have designed open spaces between floors. This includes the bar on first floor. This is a cool and happening place on a Saturday night but allows noise to rise upward to guest floors. We stayed in 252 and got full brunt of both the inside bar, fire pit outside our room and Newport Beach boulevard.   Would I stay here again maybe but would have to be inside pool view away from the open spaces (opposite side of bar)

The room was spacious enough to have guests for appetizers and wine while enjoying the breathtaking sunset and then we had dinner at the mayor’s table. A must experience!

Summary: Let me start by saying that I am an event planner. All new hotels that open up will have a few hiccups to start. No hotel ever comes out of the gate being flawless.   I travel a lot for work, and one of the benefits of my occupation is that I stay at world-class venues. Lido has three things that were the best I have ever experienced at a resort.  Valet: The best pit crew ever experienced. Not only did all the guys hustle, made sure everything is okay, and were pleasant to deal with, they anticipated what the needs of the guest were by simply looking at them. Summary: OMG, living in a 4 star resort we thought staying at Lido House would be at least the same.  How disappointing.  Food was very expensive and not of good quality.  Sitting by the pool it took well over an hour to get the food served.  The liquor served on premise was not of good quality for standard bar rates (not named brands) and then if you changed it to a higher level brand the prices exploded.  Never saw such incompetency with the front desk clerk who had to correct our bill every night when we checked it.  Intend to file a complaint with Marriott as we used our points to stay there.

Summary: I am writing this sitting by the amazing pool at The Lido House Marriott. Photos do not do justice to this amazing property. From the time my wife and I arrived, we have been treated like royalty. The service has exceeded our expectations. We are very particular about service, food, and drink. They have all been amazing. I was sad to see the negative reviews on this property. IT IS TWO WEEKS OLD! There will be some snafus opening a new hotel. They have bikes that you can rent out at no extra cost. We rode around the beach and town everyday. They have a Cadillac Escalade to take you to places on the peninsula. We tried to use it but it was in use. Summary: Was very excited to be amongst the first to stay at this new hotel for the Soft opening. The lobby, pool area & restaurants are really pretty. Aesthetically, everything is very nice.  The rooms however leave a lot to be desired. They are not functional at all for families. There is literally 1 armoire with no shelves & 2 skinny drawers below. We were unable to unpack our suitcases as there was no dresser. There is 1 hook in the bathroom located in the toilet area across the room from the shower. For a “beach” style hotel, you’d think there would be hooks everywhere to hang suits, towels, robes etc.  our power went out for 10 mins. Summary Heading: Several Bugs still to work out - Nice place though....
Summary: I used to live in Newport Beach so my expectations are rather high. As a Marriott Rewards member, I thought I use some my points to check out The Lido House. I was here on day 2 of it's opening. We had three fire alarms. The housekeepers knocked on my door at 8:00 am - on a Saturday morning, and then never came back to clean the room. One lamp never turned off, so I had to unplug it, and they have some smart system installed that turns off the room lights if no one is moving in the room - but I was moving and they still would go off and on whenever they felt like it. The food is good and it is a beautiful hotel, but I would wait until the bugs get worked out a bit before paying $400/night to stay.

Summary Heading: New, beautiful and rough around the edges
Summary: Disappointing start to our visit when we had to wait 2 hours and 45 minutes hours for a room. However Lisa Marie came to our rescue and apologized and got us into our room with a promise of buying us a drink and appetizer in the restaurant. We had lunch while waiting for our room. I had chicken and my wife had pasta. Both were good. The grounds here are beautiful.  The hotel only had its grand opening 24 hours before we arrived so everything is new and unspoiled and servers are still getting their sea legs. The location is great for the Newport Beach annual boat show which we attended as it was only a 3 minute walk. Really loved the property but the service is rough around the edges.
